utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I’m thinking.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Thinking’s not going to get you to the top.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Mom, you’re supposed to be encouraging me.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: No, I’m supposed to be coaching you. The slower you go, the more tired you’re going to get.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: There’s a hold about a foot above you on the left.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Nice grab! Keep going! You’re almost there, babe.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I can’t. My calf’s cramping.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: You need to get off your toes. Get on the ball of your foot.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I can’t…

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Yes, you can. You can get all the way to the top.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: It’s okay, I got you. You all right?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Looks like you were wrong.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Yeah, but you did awesome. That’s the highest you’ve gotten, I’m proud of you.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I don’t feel so good…

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Okay, come on down.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Mom? Mom, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Oh God…

utterance.speaker: COACH
utterance.content: Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: My arm… I think I broke it.

utterance.speaker: COACH
utterance.content: Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Oh Jane, I’m so sorry…

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: What happened? Did the rope break?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: No… My hands… I can’t move them…

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: She’s been to an ortho, two neuro’s, and an immunologist. None of the treatments have had any effect.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You think it’s over?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: It’s getting worse. Last neurologist found intermittent numbness in both arms as well as the hand paralysis.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I meant the game. You think he’s gonna keep all four of us?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Said he would. No sign of upper motor neuron involvement.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: He lies.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My ears are burning.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Tell him you’re done firing people.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well if I lie, that would be little reassurance. Dr. Kutner, who told you that it would be a good idea to put up superficial representations of a hypocritical season celebrating a mythical figure?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Wasn’t me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He lied. Homie knows better, Hymie doesn’t care, and Huntington’s would have done a better job.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I don’t have Huntington’s.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That you know of.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Why would you…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because I got sued when I called you “honeybuns”.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Am I fired if I put up —

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: The point of the game was to scare us. Telling us it’s over isn’t scary, therefore he has no reason to say that unless it’s true.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Good. Then can we do a Secret Santa?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I liked you better fifteen seconds ago when you were afraid for your job. So who’s sick?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Forty-five year old single mom. It’s an odd presentation of paralysis. Any history of drug use?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She says there’s no history.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: She’s not a liar.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, this is gonna be a tough case. I have almost no knowledge of alien physiology.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Everyone lies but there’s an exception to every rule.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Actually there isn’t. That’s kinda what makes it a rule.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: The patient’s mother died of breast cancer when she was seven and she never even knew her mom was sick. She promised herself she would never hide anything from her own daughter.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh… I didn’t know she’d promised.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: And we’re not her daughter. Patient inherited the BRCA1 mutation from her mom, she got a prophylactic double mastectomy ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She lied about it.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: She told her co-worker, she told her kid.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She lied to the world. Reconstructive surgery is designed to convince people that —

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: She didn’t get reconstructive surgery.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Okay, we can rule out breast cancer.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Actually, I was going to rule it in. Paralysis could be paraneoplastic. Even the best surgeon can’t remove every cell of breast tissue.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: MRI what’s left of her chest. Set the machine to scan for irony. I’m going to go redo the patient history.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You mom tell you about all the drugs she does?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: She smokes pot once in a while, but not in a long time.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What about you?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: How would that make her sick?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Are you a doctor?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I’m eleven…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That’s not an answer. It’s an evasion. Are you drinking? You ever sneak a drink?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I don’t do any of that stuff. It’s bad for you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I understand why you don’t want your mom to know, but I’m her doctor so —

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: And I would tell my mom. And I would tell you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Because she would never lie to me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What’s her favorite way to have sex?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I don’t get what sex has to do with breast cancer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Are you a doctor? Did you go to med school since the last time I asked?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: You just think we gotta be lying —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: White lies?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: What are those?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Those are lies we tell to make other people feel better.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I don’t lie.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Rationalizations?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: What are those?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Those are lies we tell to make ourselves feel better.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: No, we don’t —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lies of omission? Saddle bronc or doggie? That’s sex talk.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: She used to like being on top, but now she likes to be on her stomach. That way she doesn’t have to see them looking at her scars.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It’s child abuse.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Honesty?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There’s a reason that everybody lies. It works. It what allows society to function, it’s what separates man from beast.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Oh, I thought that was our thumbs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You wanna know every place your mom’s thumb has been?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I’m sorry I missed rehearsal. Am I taking the “truth is good” side? Don’t you usually take that part?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lies are a tool, they can be used either for good… No wait, I got a better one. Lies are like children. Hard work, but they’re worth it. Because the future depends on them.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You are so full of love… or something. When you care about someone —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You lie to them! You pretend that their constant ponderous musing are interesting. You tell them they’re not losing their boyish good looks or becoming worn out.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I stand corrected and may I say, it’s been a real pleasure chatting with you. Sila’s clean, surgical margins looks clear. No lymphadenopathy, no masses, no nothing. It’s not cancer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We need a new theory.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Did you catch her lying?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Wouldn’t “no” have been a shorter answer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wouldn’t you not talking have made this a shorter conversation? Kid says mom’s a slut.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: She called her mom a slut?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I called her mom a slut. Jumps anything with a pole and a pulse. Not that I’m judging here. Given her medical history, I’m actually impressed.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Maggie already admitted to having multiple sexual partners. Which is why we already tested for, and ruled out, syphilis and any other STDs that could have caused her symptoms.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: STDs aren’t the only risk in risky sex. Problem in sleeping with strangers is… they’re strange.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We’ll follow up with any recent partners.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Send Foreman and Taub. They’re better liars, more likely to get to the truth.

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: You think I drugged her? Use a coaster.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We’re not cops. Legally, we don’t care one way or another.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: But we need to know the truth so we can help her.

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: I’d known her for less than an hour and she offered to take me home. There was no need to drug her.

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: Not that I would.

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: But she’s gonna be okay, right?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: As long as she doesn’t have to pick up or hold anything.

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: Uh, sorry. I just had the floors done. Reclaimed pine.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You always this thirsty?

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: I don’t know… Water’s supposed to be good for you, right?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Dehydration, anxiety, aggression…

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: I’m not aggressive.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Spastic chorea in his right hand.

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: What about my hand?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How much do you weight? About 180, 190?

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: 180. What is —

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You took what she did, it could take longer to hit you. Might affect you differently.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: But you didn’t give her anything. Right?

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: She was really drunk… I just gave her some E, to help enhance things.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Have any of it left?

utterance.speaker: ROGER
utterance.content: Is my hand gonna be okay?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: There’s nothing wrong with it. We lied.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: I’ve had a sore throat for a few days now. My stomach’s also been bothering me. I think my glands are swollen.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Saint Nicholas?

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: Patron saint of children.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Also seamen, merchants, archers, prostitutes, and prisoners.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: Hmm… Must have been pretty hardworking.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or just a credit hog.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Open wide. Say “aah”.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: Is it contagious?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Only for the next 24 hours as long as you take the antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: How contagious?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Take a personal day.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: I can’t!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I’ll write your pimp a note.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: My pimp?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You’re tested for AIDS every three months and… your necklace.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: Prostitutes wear religious symbols?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think they just like kneeling. You don’t have the skin of a seaman, the fingers of an archer, the clothes of a merchant, or the attitude of an ex-con. So, just leaves one left.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: Mmm… Two actually. But I’m not a child, am I?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You owe me 50 bucks.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then you owe me half a lapdance.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It’s for the nurses’ holiday bonus. I know you got the memo.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Got the memo last year. I want to hire forty more fellows.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You already fired the ones you hired?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They work better when they’re scared.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You were right. Guy slipped her Ecstasy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He have any symptoms?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: No. Kutner’s starting the patient on hemodialysis and Thirteen’s in the lab trying to figure out what the guy put in the drugs.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: See? Clear, simple statement of facts describing their cooperation, with absolutely no attitude or fear.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Something’s gotta be done.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I still can’t move my hands.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: It will take a few more hours to cycle all your blood through the machine.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Nothing. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: What do you mean? The lights just went out. Didn’t they?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Is this from the drugs?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Most of the drugs should be out of your system by now and our drugs —

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I can’t see…

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Do something!

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I can’t see! I can’t see!

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Nothing in the Ecstasy except Ecstasy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well that never hurt anybody.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Can’t make them blind days later.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Do you spell “homie” with a Y?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I want to be respectful.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You’re actually going to let us do Secret Santa?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not just you guys. I like presents too. Pick a name.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Why are you doing this?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: See, this is why no one likes your people.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The notion of picking one time of the year to be decent to other people is obscene, because it’s actually validating the notion of being miserable wretches the rest of the year.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: So you think this is the part of the year they screwed up?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On the other hand, you are now a team. Gotta work together and the simple fact is, giving people crap makes people like people so spend 25 bucks. Learn to love…

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Blindness could be a complication from the hemodialysis.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: No, the dialysate composition was within range. Sweet.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: The dialysate composition just indicates —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Indicates nothing. I was referring to his reaction to the name he got.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I was pleased. I thought it’d be fun to buy for —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Means… there’s someone here who wouldn’t be fun to buy for. I wonder who. Pick a name, then go check out the patient’s house.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Interesting…

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We’re wasting time going to the home. Kearns-Sayer syndrome fits the symptoms. [takes a name from the stocking and tucks it into his jacket’s inner pocket without even looking.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No family history of Kearns. Go to their house —

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: They would have told us if there were any other drugs. You met her, she couldn’t have been more candid.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You’re absolutely right. Go to their house —

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: MS or a vascular problem fits better. They could affect hands and eyes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine. Do an MRI, check for MS. And a fluorescein angiogram of her eyes to see if we missed a bleed somewhere.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh! And whoever goes to their house… get me their computers.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You talk to your kid about sex so she’ll think you’re being open about everything. Keeps her from asking questions about the things you don’t want to talk about.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: That’s right. Her honesty proves just how dishonest she is.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes! Exactly who I wanted. This is going to be fun.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: The dye may sting when it enters your bloodstream,

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Are you scared, mom?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Are you?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Are they?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: They don’t look scared.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Either they’re confident or they just don’t care.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We’re confident.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Okay if I shift you a bit? Get you into position.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Your boss is weird.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Yeah, he is. He thought he’d get information you may not have been telling us by…

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Being a jerk?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You’d be surprised how often it works.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Choroidal flush looks good.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Why would people lie to a doctor?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Dozens of reasons to lie, only one reason to tell the truth.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: You’re never even tempted? I mean, lies do sometimes smooth things out, make life easier.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Yeah? Your life easy?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not even close. Dye’s reached the retinal capillary bed. No leakage.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: That’s… good, right?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: It means it’s not a vascular problem.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: But?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Vascular problem, we could fix.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: They look worried now, mom.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What’s with the Secret Santa? You trying to bring them together?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I want to drive them apart.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: With gift giving?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Conflict’s built right into the name. Santa’s about sharing, secret’s about withholding.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Aside from the Trojan horse, gifts don’t usually —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What did you get your wife for your final anniversary?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Uh… a sweater.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: She hated it.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: She loved it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then you didn’t buy it.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I… gave her some cash and…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Gifts allow us to demonstrate exactly how little we know about a person and nothing pisses off a person more than being shoved in the wrong pigeon hole.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I’m thinking of spending a few extra bucks on my Secret Santa.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Bad idea. You mind if I tell House you asked them for the key instead of breaking in?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Yes, I do. Just another five bucks.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Five will be ten. The key’s proof she doesn’t have anything to hide.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: The key is proof I didn’t do exactly what House told me to do. And what do you care if it’s another fifteen?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I’m gonna tell him. And who are you so anxious to please?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Not you. You really think you’re going to prove people are capable of honesty using a mother and daughter you’ve known for one day?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I’m not the one who’s based his entire world view on the proposition. If I’m wrong, so what? If he’s wrong…

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: So you really have Huntington’s?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: But House said that —

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: If I wanted to talk about it, why didn’t I bring it up?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Fluorescein angiogram was clear. No leaks, no lesions, definitely not a vascular problem.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Someone get their birthdays out of the file.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Have you tried leaving it blank?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Tough to get into the head of someone who actually trusts people, huh? Found both computers in an office, on a desk they share.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: No sign of macular degeneration or optic neuritis. Her eyes are completely normal.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Except she can’t see out of them.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So she says. Find anything on the MRI?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No sign of plaques. It’s not MS.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We haven’t found anything abnormal on any test.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Except she can’t see or move her hands.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So she says.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You can’t lie about flaccid paralysis.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Maybe she’s not lying.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Her brain is. What if it’s a conversion disorder?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Lacks personal boundaries… Promiscuous… Inappropriate obsession with truth-telling… Certainly sounds like a psych case.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Cool. I’ll set up a psych consult and start her on anti-depressants.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Her mind is tricking her body. We need to trick her mind. Or even better.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You don’t need her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Then this serves no medical purpose.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You have a genetic defect, you choose to ignore it. This woman has a genetic defect, chooses to butcher herself to be safe. Yet what you claim to be fascinated by, is her honesty. Interesting.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You claim to want the truth, and then you screw with people who actually live by it. Pathetic.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey, I gave you credit for interesting.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You’re protecting her because you’re jealous she did what you couldn’t.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I need you.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I’m not lying to her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Fine, keep your mouth shut. I still need you. If it doesn’t work, you gotta hold the kid down until someone else finishes lying to mom.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That does actually serve a medical purpose.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Jane.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I have to lie because she trusts me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you show doubt, the placebo treatment won’t work.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: If it’s just depression, that’s good news right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A lot of great medications.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: So why can’t we just give her those? Why do we have to lie to her?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because we might be wrong. And those medications take a long time to work and since your mom’s condition is declining, there’s a chance the drugs won’t tell us anything until it’s too late.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: My mom’s not depressed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Maybe she’s hiding it from you.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: No. She wouldn’t —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just doing what every good mom does. Protecting her child from bad news that she can’t do anything about.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: My mom’s never lied to me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You don’t know how to lie. You don’t know how to tell when you’re being lied to.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Maybe you’re right…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know —

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I was lying. I know how to lie. I just won’t do it to my mother.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You like foosball?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Until the treatment of your infectious parapheresis takes effect, Jane can’t come back into the room. I’ve already been inoculated.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Can she have it already?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Don’t worry. It’s a very effective treatment, you should be feeling better in a matter of minutes.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Don’t you think Jane deserves a few secrets? Some personal space? Room to uh… make her own mistakes?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: She makes plenty of mistakes. Only difference is, I’m there to help her through them.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: But she’s gotta know you’re looking over her shoulder. It’s gotta stifle —

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: You think the world would be a better place if everybody always acted like their mom was looking over their shoulder?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I wanna go see my mom.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: She’s sleeping. Why don’t we just double the amount we can spend?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Can’t afford another twenty-five?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We allow people fifty, people will spend sixty.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Ah, so you can’t afford another thirty-five.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: You must really like who you got…

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Or really dislike.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: My mom always gives the best presents to the teachers I get along with the worst.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: How do you know “no”?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: I know you didn’t get House.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I know he didn’t get House.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You gave them all your name?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. Figured I could sow some dissension and get a few ties and sweaters.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What happens when they find out?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It’s Secret Santa.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What happens when they find out?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They’ll argue about what to do with that information. Ties are less important than the dissension.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Well we still have to buy him something.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Not a chance!

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We weren’t supposed to discuss this. We’re not supposed to know.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He’s not supposed to put his name in there five times!

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: He wants presents. It’s sad…

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: It’s pathetic.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I’m still buying him a present.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: No. You’re not.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I think it’s getting worse. Can’t breathe…

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: I need a nurse in here!

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Her lymph nodes are cutting off her airway. We gotta intubate!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Swollen lymph nodes were cutting off Maggie’s airway. We shrunk them with alcohol, she’s breathing on her own now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, that sucks.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 4300 saved emails and not a single mention of “lesbionic”, “sanchez” or “man-gina”.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Swollen lymph nodes means it wasn’t psychological.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Who’s that from?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Santa, obviously. ‘Cause you know I worship him. No wait, I mean Satan. I always get them confused. What is… an alpine butterfly? And why is she learning how to do one?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House, we already have a full history. You don’t need to waste time —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It’s just a climbing knot.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: But what does she use it for? Try “bondage”.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I did once. And she just tied me down and whined about how hard it is to be Dean of Medicine.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Gyms aren’t exactly pristine, could be a fungal infection. Seriously, who’s it from?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No fever, no elevated white count.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That’s funny… Friend sent her a Garfield cartoon. That cat sure does love lasagna.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: House. Stop obsessing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If it weren’t for my obsessions, you wouldn’t know that she has sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Eighteen months ago, she sold her Stairmaster. It was only two months old. Now either she needed the cash or climbing stairs was getting more difficult. Twelve months ago, she cancelled a hiking trip. Now she either just wanted to sit home and watch TV or walking was getting more difficult. She’s been suffering joint pain for the last two years.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Pull my ribbon. If you know what I mean.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: ACE levels are too low for sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That’s not what I meant. Could just be an inactive phase.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: It’s not Christmas yet.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I remembered. I’m not a Satanist, I’m a druid.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No lung involvement.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yet.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We’ll need a bronchoalveolar lavage to confirm it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: That’s a shame. I’m not gonna surprise her with one for Christmas.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wow!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Now either that cost more than 25 bucks or I’m seriously starting to doubt Steve Jobs’ business strategies.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thanks!

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Last round of saline, Maggie. One more big breath. We’ve gotta get the liquid to go all the way into your lungs, okay? Here we go.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Gift could be from a patient.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Who sent it to the wrong doctor?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: House obviously gave the present to himself.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They’re arguing right now.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I’ve been looking for this all morning.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you look in the box on my desk? Oh by the way, your mom called. Your dad’s dead.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You left the present sitting on your desk?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It wouldn’t have been as effective sitting in my closet in my home.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: They’re gonna know it’s from you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, they’re gonna guess that it was from me. Might even be 90% sure that it was from me but all that means is, they’re 10% sure that one of the other guys is screwing them over.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Have you ever considered channeling your powers to, I don’t know… bring peace to the mid-east?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I couldn’t do that.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: But if they ever got it, you could screw it up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s more where my powers lie.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Gift could be from Wilson.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: It’s House.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Why do you have a problem with him speculating?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Because. That’s what House wants us to do.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Lungs are pristine, no infiltrates or alveolar hemorrhage.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Maggie, I’m gonna remove the scope. I need you to cough for me, okay?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: A little harder.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Maggie… Open your eyes.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Why aren’t you saying anything?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Maggie tested negative for sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: But she’s bleeding into her eyes now.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Have her platelets dropped?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Plummeted. New labs show they’re under 40. She’ll bleed out of every orifice if we don’t find the cause.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Could be splenic sequestration, tuberculosis —

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Gaucher disease, TTP —

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Hemolytic uremic syndrome, sepsis, lupus —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Listing all the possible causes is only impressive if you can do it reverse alphabetically. We need to know why her platelet machine is broken. Go to the factory. Do a bone marrow aspiration.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I’m your Secret Santa.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well you’re not supposed to tell.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: But you got a present already. Which means you have more than one Secret Santa.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Or… somebody else wants to make me happy.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Merry Christmas.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: On one hand, you should be in bed. On the other hand, I told you to rest so… I see your dilemma.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: I don’t think resting is the problem. Can strep cause this?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Clap on.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: Trust me, first place I went. No rash on my labia. Do you need to take a look?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I’m saving my money for a Red Ryder BB-gun.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Darker shade of lipstick?

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: I’m not wering any.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You tell your mother what you do?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter. I’m curious.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: I don’t need to break her heart just do I can feel righteous.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You do a donkey show? I’m not curious. It matters.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: It’s a donkey or a mule… I can never remember.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wow… That is a creepy smile. I bet the donkey’s is even creepier.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: Do I have to explain?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope. It’s my job. Contagious ecthyma. Any contact can cause rashes, flu symptoms, sore throat. Has there been… contact?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay. Antibiotic cream for you and a love glove for Francis. You’ll both be fine.

utterance.speaker: MELANIE
utterance.content: You should come see the show. I think you’d like it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry, I hate Westerns.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So they really never lie?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Doesn’t seem like it. Admirable. You tell Cameron everything?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Hah! No.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You think she keeps secrets?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: If I knew, they wouldn't be secrets. I hope she does. People have a right to a little privacy, even from the people they love.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You buy House a present?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Why would I?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: To screw with me.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Then I’m gonna say yes.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No no, wait. Stop, stop. What’s that smell?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Her bone is smoking.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Her bones are harder than the drill?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: We ran a full body bone scan to find the cause of hardening in the hip. No hotspots anywhere.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Tracer could have been inactive.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: So I screwed up the test?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: There’s so many ways that could have happened. Maybe it was inactive, maybe it didn’t fully circulate.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: It circulated, the camera picked up —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey, hey. It’s Christmas! Why are you guys fighting?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Why do you think there are no hotspots?

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I did not screw up! The density’s consistent.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Just means the density was consistent, doesn’t mean it was cold. It’s possible… all she has are hotspots. It’s consistent because her entire skeleton is turning to stone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Good for an aspiring superhero. Fatal for a human hoping to make it to Kwanzaa.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Well it’s gotta be from a carbonic anhydrase type 2 deficiency.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It has free will. It doesn’t have to be anything doesn’t want to be.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: I meant, if it’s not CAII… well, none of the other causes of osteopetrosis are treatable.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You’re right, it’s gotta be. Go run her blood and hope that your sunny optimism isn’t misplaced.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: They accused Kutner of screwing up a test. Because they hate him.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You’re surprised? That’s the sort of crap that happens when you mess with people’s heads.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well one day he will screw up a test. If they don’t accuse him of that because they like him, someone could die. Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Nowhere, I just know it hurts you.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: CAII deficiency is a genetic disorder that scrambles proteins. If the blood test is positive, you’ll need a bone marrow transplant.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: “Transplant” sounds like a euphemism for “slim odds”.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Uh… Slim, but not none.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: We’re gonna need to test Jane for a match.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Don’t you have donor banks?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Jane is your best bet. Procedure’s perfectly safe, there’s no risk.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: No risk.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Any surgery has —

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Then don’t tell me there’s no risk. You going to tell me there’s no pain either?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: The testing will hurt a little…

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: If she doesn’t do this and you don’t make it… she’s going to spend the rest of her life blaming herself.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Mom… Please.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: Find someone else. Let someone else take the risk.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Donor bank turned up a 49 year old man in Cleveland who’s a five out of six HLA match. First flight out of Cleveland leaves —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why is a 49 year old Cleveland man a closer match than her daughter?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: He may not be. Maggie didn’t let us test her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Pain, danger, risk of —

utterance.speaker: tHOUSE
utterance.content: Only reason to give multiple reasons is you’re searching for what the person wants to hear.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You’re wrong about sainted mommy.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Don’t care. You can forget the donor bank, there’s no CAII deficiency. Best we can do is make her comfortable.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Is that from Taub?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, it is.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Merry Christmas. Who’s going to tell the patient she’s dying?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I will. And nobody leaves here until we find out what killed her.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Whatever she has is fatal. Makes no difference if it’s disease number 58 or 907.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: You guys mad at me?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: Nope. You had no choice.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Of course I had a choice. You had no choice once I made my choice.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: And now I’m choosing not to be mad at you.

utterance.speaker: KUTNER
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: ‘Cause it will drive House nuts.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And you think that’ll make your lives better or worse?

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I told my mom I don’t care what she thinks. I want you to test my marrow.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I can’t be dying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sure you can.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: You’re wrong. You don’t even know what I have.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What you have, is one last Christmas with your daughter. One last chance to give her a present. The truth. Inexpensive, highly valued, never have to stand in line to return it the day after Christmas.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A mother who’s going to die doesn’t refuse a donor test because it might hurt. She refuses when she knows it won’t match. Which tends to happen when mother and daughter aren’t mother and daughter.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I could do DNA tests, if you’d rather keep lying to me.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I never wanted kids. I love them but with my genes… I knew this woman, a drug addict. She got pregnant, didn’t want to have an abortion. But she also didn’t want her daughter to ever know who her real mother was. What she was. I promised never to tell.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A promise to an addict is worth more than a promise to your daughter?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: It’d be cruel to tell her.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Right. She lives a lie, you get to die a hypocrite.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Mom… The doctors told me what’s happening.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: It’s gonna be okay, sweetheart. I promise you. Doctors can be wrong. There’s still a chance I can be —

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: You really believe that?

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: No, mom. You’re dying. Nobody can help you. It’s not going to be okay.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: That was cold.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What did you get for Christmas?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I got a watch, a vintage LP, and a second edition Conan Doyle. If that wasn’t bad enough, my patient’s dying.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Christmas deaths in a hospital, nothing more depressing. No one ever wants to go in the patient’s room, even the candy stripers leave them alone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I saw something amazing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Pure truth. She told her mother that she was dying. Stripped her of all hope.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: That sounds… horrible.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It’s like watching some… bizarre astronomical event that you know you’re never going to see again.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You tell people the cold hard truth all the time. You get off on it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because I don’t care. She cared. She did it anyway. She did it because she cared.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: The angels of Christmas have finally given House a present he can appreciate.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Oh, don’t ruin it. Don’t pin this on Christ, he’s got enough nails in him.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Patient had to die but —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why don’t you take off that hat?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It’s Christmas! It’s a reindeer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It’s a moose, on a Jew.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Who cares?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Things have their place. You wouldn’t hang dreidels from a Christmas tree.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You could. Things don’t care.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No. They don’t.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Happy Solstice, House.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: To save us all from Satan’s power, when we were gone astray. Have you people no holiday spirit? Bring me the eggnog of good cheer!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House, if you have something to say, say it. If you don’t, give us a chance to get home before Santa.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Scrooge. Give the patient rispiradone.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: That’s an anti-psychotic. She’s dying, she’s not crazy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I am going to perform a Christmas miracle.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: You said all the causes of osteopetrosis were fatal.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Except for the one we discounted early, because it was impossible. When fetus forms, it’s just a mass of cells. Breast tissue covers extensive portions of the body. As the fetus develops, most of this tissue recedes, remaining only in the fun places. But sometimes, extra breast tissue is left behind in places where it doesn’t belong. Rispiradone does a lot of things. One is, it makes breast tissue swell so we can find it more easily.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: You’re telling me I could have breast cancer? Somewhere not in my breast? That doesn’t make sense.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Taub’s parents have a winter condo in Florida. They’re still New Yorkers.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: Actually, my parents —

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don’t care. I told a parable. And now, I’m going to raise the dead…

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Give me that syringe.

utterance.speaker: THIRTEEN
utterance.content: That’s gotta be a fat deposit.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes, I could be wrong. If I am, she’s dead so shut up.

utterance.speaker: TAUB
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Rispiradone also causes galactorrhea.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: What’s that? Galactic…?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Open your mouth.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Relax, you’ve had it before.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I am not —

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: Milk? Eww!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We’ll cut out your mom’s tumor and start her on chemo. All the rest of your symptoms should go away.

utterance.speaker: MAGGIE
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: JANE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Have a wonderful life.
